intro: Acrostichum salicinum, commonly known as the broadleaf tree fern, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is characterized by its large, feather-like fronds that can grow up to several meters in length. The plant has a robust, trunk-like stem covered in a fibrous, spongy material. Its reproductive structures, including spore-bearing cones, are typically found at the base of the fronds. Acrostichum salicinum thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
